comment: Work ahead as much as possible, there is a lot of course work in this class. The professor is really great and helpful but like I said, set yourself up for success and work ahead.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Awesome Professor! Lots of work and group projects.  Get started early on assignments so you won't fall behind.

Dr. Mattord was an excellent professor. I took CYBR4810 Capstone for summer 23 semester, and would HIGLY recommend getting ahead of any assignments possible. You will be working on 5, 6, 7 and sometimes 8 assignments due every week so please don't fall behind. It can become pretty overwhelming but if you stay organized, you will do fine.

Professor Herb is a really nice guy. Just do the work and you will be fine. I would recommend starting the work early or just reviewing the requirements sooner because it can get a bit confusing at first. He can respond a little late but not always, so just be aware of that. He really cares about his students and wants you to learn!
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Mattord is a one-of-a-kind professor. He's kind, humble, shares cool stories, and is always open to feedback. To repeat another review, this is a front-heavy class. Lots of group work, but I met some great classmates and we enjoyed working together. It's a simulation-style capstone, and I loved it. It preps you for the real world.

ISA 4820 is a heavily front loaded class that then moves to coasting. I enjoyed the work but don't get behind. What is a little irritating is that some of the assignments require way more work than others but they are worth the same amount of points. Dr. Mattord is very fair an approachable. I feel like he cares about his students a lot.
Straightforward fella
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I managed to get an A in the class and I'm not the most gifted ISA person at all. If you do all of the assignments, discussion questions etc and study for tests and quizzes and attempt the labs you can make an A in the class. There are issues and glitches with the labs but as  you attempt them you'll be fine! You'll learn alot in this class.

Great Professor! Very through in lectures and clear in what to expect in the class. Study and do the work and you will be fine. If you do not do good in this class then either you didn't try or InfoSec is not for you. Work load and material is heavy, but you will learn a lot, because there is a lot to learn.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I had an A and that got changed at the last minute, besides that read the book and do the labs.
Most helpful professor I ever have seen.

I took this class online. A majority of the assignments are due on two separate dates. You have online quizzes for every chapter (in lock-down browser). You have easy labs and you have to do discussion questions. There are other assignments and one paper. I don't know how I am doing, because he hasn't graded anything yet. Mid-term was mostly vocab
He is great. He not only teach you the subject, he teach you to be a better person. I wish other professor does the same.

Very nice and helpful. Offers fun insight during lectures. The bulk of work is due two different periods throughout the semester, so you can work at your own pace. Work is interesting and not tedious. I would recommend.

Not a hard professor. Took it online and got an A. Only hard part is this fake profile of a company, that you must suggest security recommendations. Everything else is easy. Easy tests...easy labs....Good at explaining and helping also. Highly Recommended.

This professor assisted in writing the text book so expect to read the entire thing. My only real complaint is that many of the labs did not work properly. I think that is unacceptable in an online IT class. That really needs to be resolved.

The class is not for the slacker there are many assignments the he assigns. The assignments are mostly short except for the seta project.The hardest thing in the class are tests many questions you haven't seen before.

I'm not an ISA major, I just took his class because I was in a learning community. He's a VERY GOOD professor who has an effective teaching style. Don't take him if you want an easy class, rather take him if you want to get taught right.

Very nice professor, extremely knowledgeable. 20% of grade is open book quizzes with an unlimited # of attempts. He gives you labs & podcasts to work on & there is some discussion board posting; not too bad. The hardest assignment was a SETA plan, but he worked & changed the assignment so we could understand it. =P I would def take this prof again.
Very fair. Lots of work but it was an online class so that's to be expected. Extremely reasonable and very helpful. I look forward to having him again for future classes.

Was online class, lots of work, huge amount of podcasts to listen too, answer questions in back of book, read every chapter, and numerous labs to complete. This class takes a lot of time, but I took it in the summer.  Teacher is very knowledgeable.  Posts lectures to listen to online on top off all. Will be spending a lot of time on your computer.

Took the online class. I thought the class was pretty simple. The work load for this class is a bit ridiculous, but I guess he was required to make us do something since it was an online class. The textbook was my lifesaver.

Took online. Great recorded lectures, and good textbook (he helped write it). Heavy workload however, and extremely comprehensive. You will only get an A in this course if you stay on top of ALL assignments, including semester project.

I took this prof in an online course and I was extremely disappointed. He basically dumped the information at the beginning of the course and you were on your own. His lectures were from the previous semester, the links to assignments apparently were too because they were often broken. He provided little to no actual teaching. Take someone else.

Very passionate about what he teaches. Great professor. Class was really easy. Small assignments and quizzes which if you follow the instructions, you will get a 100 on them. Don't have to go to class, he posts his recorded lectures online. It is like a hybrid course if you want it to be.

He's really passionate about network security but the work load is ridiculous! I made an A but I worked my behind off. The labs are very vague, lecturers are not very interesting but highly recommended. If you want to do good, follow INSTRUCTIONS otherwise you'll loose a lot of marks. Start you research paper on time and CITE whatever you write!!!

HM is great. He is truly passionate about the field. He is always available for students, he wants to hear from you; suggestions, problems, and advice. We ISA students are truly lucky to have HM at KSU. One of the best professors, I've ever had. LOTS OF WORK, but HM is very understanding. Exams are rough even being open note. Very obliged to HM THX

I am soo glad Dr Mattord is here for us at KSU. Great instructor in every way. A really good guy. He is passionate about the material. He is anxious to hear your questions, suggestion, and your problems. For us who are trully fused about ISA, we are very lucky. This class is LOTS OF WORK, but its worth it. Only wish the labs were more complicated.
One stop shot! Can't go wrong on this prof. He knows his stuff very well.Go to class, listen, do online quizzes, revise 'em 4 d exam & u r running towards an A. Also very helpful!

Mattord is awesome! He still teaches ISA 3100 like the pre-req is CSIS 2520 though so thats a downer for people who haven't taken it yet but he makes up for it. He is really clear and lots of fun, you will enjoy coming to class
Outstanding professor, Tests are hard, so make sure to take notes as he is doing his lectures. Take him  if you can. You won't be disappointed.

Very fair, very clear.  It is so obvious that he enjoys his job and the subject matter.  Have had for several classes, DO NOT pass up a chance for his class. He makes them easy by making sure you get it.

THE BEST PROF. SO FAR @ KSU. FUN CLASS, EVERYTHING IS PRACTICAL...GIVES STUFFS HE DID IN CLASS AS ASSIGNMENTS.VERY WILLING TO HELP.ONCE U ATTEND CLASS, U CAN'T FAIL. REVIEW EVERY ONLINE QUIZ FOR YOUR EXAMS & U R ALREADY WAITING FOR AN "A". NOT A GOOD CLASS TO SKIP COZ IT REALLY HAUNTS U @ THE END OF THE SEMESTER...ALSO TAKES ATTENDANCE.
Excellent teacher, very clear.  As long as you follow instructions you'll get an A
Very good teacher. Very helpful. If you do homework and read the book you get A. He explains well.

Great class!  Great teacher!  Extremely intelligent and really knows his stuff.  He made class enjoyable.  Also, I met my husband in this class so that made it even better!  Would definitely take this class and this teacher again!
very good teacher...lots of work...do it all and you will get an A!

Wow, my hand is tired from his class.  More writing than I have ever had before.  Used more ink and killed more trees that I thought could be possible.  Fun guy, really smart, lots of work, do it and you'll do fine.

have had for CSIS 4840 and ISA 3300; is good teacher, if do work you will get A.  4840 requires writing 2-3 1-1and a half pages a week, ethics protfolio and a 15 page research paper.  wall to wall writing
